result.execSummary:
The defendant Laurence A Clay was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).
  • Theft-Business Setting <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Laurence A Clay in court with attorney Craig Robert Johnson.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

The defendant has complied with the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.

On motion of the state, the court amended Count 1 to TWO (2) COUNTS of Theft-Business Setting, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 943.20(1)(b), a class A Misdemeanor.   Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction to the amended charge.

AS TO COUNT 1:

Court sentenced defendant to serve NINE (9) MONTHS in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for ONE (1) day served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE AND PLACED THE DEFENDANT ON PROBATION FOR A PERIOD OF TWO (2) YEARS.  If REVOKED,  Court will allow Electronic Monitoring and Huber for work.

 
AS TO COUNT 2:

Court sentenced defendant to serve THREE (3) MONTHS in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for ZERO (0) day served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE AND PLACED THE DEFENDANT ON PROBATION FOR A PERIOD OF TWO (2) YEARS.  If REVOKED,  Court will allow Electronic Monitoring and Huber for work.

Court ordered Restitution payable to Astronautics Corporation of America in the amount of TWELVE THOUSAND THREE HUNDRED AND NINETY NINE DOLLARS ($12,399.00).

Court orders defendant to pay all costs, fees, surcharges AND restitution or a civil judgment to be entered with tax intercept.  Bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.

In the event that Restitution is PAID IN FULL,  Probation MAY be terminated earlier than 

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form.
By agreement of the Parties,  matter is RESCHEDULED to 04-25-2016 at 01:30 pm.  sdg

Defendant Laurence A Clay in court with attorney Craig Robert Johnson.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defense reports that Defendant has paid $1,401.00 in restitution.  Based upon the defendant's compliance with Deferred Prosecution Agreement, matter is adjourned for final review hearing in Branch 33.  Review hearing scheduled for April 11, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Laurence A Clay in court with attorney Craig Robert Johnson.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Defendant needs to pay restitution.  

All parties notified, effective August 1, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Carl Ashley, Branch 33, in room 113 in the Safety Building.  Any right of substitution begins to run as of the date of receipt of this notice, unless notified by the court on an earlier date.  Review hearing scheduled for November 9, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Court ordered a turn-over to JusticePoint.

The parties have agreed to a deferred judgment agreement.
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, pled GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgment of Conviction.  The court approved the Deferred Prosecution Agreement and ordered the case transferred to Judge Brostrom, Branch 6 for a Review Hearing.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.

Defendant Laurence A Clay in court with attorney Craig Robert Johnson.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brostrom, Branch 6.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Review hearing scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court appearance scheduled in Room 310, Safety Building, on 4/6/15 @ 1:30pm
